website_summaries.verdict: One of the best web design books focused on many of the modern programming languages for web development.
pros: Spends a good amount of time on CSS and how it ties into general Web development with HTML
Beginner friendly and easy to follow with the chapter structure
cons: The inclusion of 4 separate programming languages may be more than CSS beginners want or need

customer_reviews.title: 5 Stars for sure, ignore the 1 star review
customer_reviews.text: I have been learning Web Development for almost two years now and I'm still finding new & useful things from this book. This book provides plenty of examples and opportunities to do exercises. Ignore the 1 Star review where the guy said his wife didn't learn anything. Completely bogus review.
customer_reviews.author: William Mooney

customer_reviews.title: Geared toward CSS not toward actual programming
customer_reviews.text: The title of this book is really a misnomer. It's not a book about web design. It's a book about website fashioning. In other words, it doesn't teach you to build a functional website (other than a very basic HTML page that takes 5 mins). It teaches you to make one prettier. I already have half a dozen CSS books. After five chapters and not really learning anything new, I perused the remainder of the book and returned it. Granted I have over a decade of web design and programming experience but haven't done it in a long time. The new generation who are calling themselves web designers are not really web designers. :(
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Book
customer_reviews.text: Ive been tinkering with web design for years just for fun but wanted to get serious about learning new and updated technologies. This is a great class in a book on web design and Jennifer provides clear explanations to technical topics. Im reading every page as she provides great references for further reading. Highly recommend this book before you even take classes. Ive tried an online class but this book is way better.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Carter

customer_reviews.title: Great Book
customer_reviews.text: I am taking classes on HTML, CSS and JacaScript. This book breaks everything down to a very basic level. I have good understanding of what I am getting myself into as coding was not a language I spoke. Excellent for beginners or people that are far more advanced.
customer_reviews.author: Jax B

customer_reviews.title: The Basics and Then Some to Build a Website
customer_reviews.text: There is a wealth of information here, carefully and meticulously presented--I cannot say enough to applaud the author's effort--on how to design via proper code elements, attributes, css styles, and some JavaScript, the layout of a website. Through the chapter examples the author practically stays with you each step of the way in adding structure, style, and/or functionality to the elements that would make up a website. As a beginner I find this a very helpful resource. Where things go beyond the scope, the author points you to countless resources--other books, websites, etc. that can elaborate on the concepts. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: DjC

customer_reviews.title: Great Web Design book!
customer_reviews.text: I've barely scratched the surface, but I really love what I'm reading so far. Jennifer, the author, really takes time to teach you about everything you need to know as a web designer/developer. I love all-in-one books and this book covers HTML, CSS, and Java Script. I'm a computer programmer learning web design and I really appreciate the in depth instruction, the color coded pages, and basically how everything is in color makes it a lot easier to understand on a website level (unlike many other books which are just in black and white).
customer_reviews.author: Sonia

customer_reviews.title: Teachers and Professors: this is your book
customer_reviews.text: I teach web design at the college level. We focus on the fundamentals so the students understand how and why HTML and CSS work the way they do. It makes them better designers. Their code is semantic, elegant, and efficient. It’s also accessible by default. All because of this book. Jennifer’s book is the go-to textbook for students. I can’t recommend it enough.
customer_reviews.author: Erik Dunham

customer_reviews.title: Good for someone who is starting right at the beginning
customer_reviews.text: This book introduces and explains the concepts and goes on to run through the HTML structures, styles and CSS, some JavaScript, the Document Object Model (DOM), and looks at the use of images in web pages and the things that can be done on a webpage. Someone who has not done this before should be able to design simple webpages after working through this book. If, having read it and worked through it, you want to do more advanced stuff on your webpages, you would need another book covering JQuery, ReactJS and server-side programming using Node.js for example.
customer_reviews.author: Malcolm Cowan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent - great for my needs
customer_reviews.text: exactly what I was looking for. very well written for my needs as a beginner. I really liked the inclusion of further references in each section. only downside is the price.
customer_reviews.author: gary d. smith

customer_reviews.title: Great book for any level of HTML learner
customer_reviews.text: I started reading this book with an average understanding of HTML. The author provides wonderful background information for beginners as well as tips that I didn't know. I haven't finished the book yet but the book is already worth its price!
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Ridgway

customer_reviews.title: OK book for beginners
customer_reviews.text: It is a good book for web design, but more advanced concepts are not covered. I need it for a class I am taking this fall, and this new edition is similar to previous ones.
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: One of the best books of this type that I have ever used.
customer_reviews.text: This tome is well organized and very clear. I have had many years of programming experience, but no exposure to html or css at all. I "volunteered" to create a web site for my next class reunion, and this book walked me right through it. I could not recommend it more highly. This should have at least a 4.9 star rating.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what you’re looking for
customer_reviews.text: One of the most comprehensive books on the subject. I had been looking for something like this for awhile.
customer_reviews.author: N R

customer_reviews.title: Learn Latest Versions of HTML and CSS
customer_reviews.text: The latest versions of HTML and CSS are clearly explained with many examples to clarify the text. She provides multiple exercises in every chapter to help solidify what was learned. She also provides references to many other sources, if you want to go into depth on a specific topic. The book is really well done.
customer_reviews.author: Carter

customer_reviews.title: Best and most easy to follow
customer_reviews.text: I love the book, the explanations and the detailed exercises to follow. It helps to learn things slowly and build pages quickly. Practice, practice and more practice with Robbins will do the trick. .
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany D. Talavera

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic primer
customer_reviews.text: When it comes to markup, style, and user interface, this is a great primer to get you up and running. I learned a bit and I’ve been writing HTML for 20 years.
customer_reviews.author: Jrhd437

customer_reviews.title: the best book in its class
customer_reviews.text: so many wonderful examples! and little details other authors skip over!
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey D

customer_reviews.title: Great book!
customer_reviews.text: Good book with a lot of information. It also gave a lot of free online resources that could be accessed for some of the more difficult concepts to grasp when you are taking the class online.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Thorough and uses experts in the field
customer_reviews.text: Learning Web Design is an excellent book. It is well written, has beautiful images, examples are easy to follow, very thorough, an abundance of resources for your file, and current experts in the field. I use this as my Bible for web design.
customer_reviews.author: Annette

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Good information for my new webpage. Going to use a lot of the new methods especially for pictures. Liked the information for phone screen.
customer_reviews.author: Göran Berntsson

customer_reviews.title: Easy to understand
customer_reviews.text: I haven't seen another book that was so well written. Every page easy to understand. Great Book
customer_reviews.author: Albert Blais

customer_reviews.title: Very Easy read.
customer_reviews.text: It had been years since I last worked on a website. This book played out in simple terms the many different changes that have occurred and how to build a page today.
customer_reviews.author: shelly

customer_reviews.title: Web design text
customer_reviews.text: Great book. Lots of examples that build in complexity. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Bvette

customer_reviews.title: Easy to understand
customer_reviews.text: I liked how easy it is to read this book without getting overwhelmed.
customer_reviews.author: kalina

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed.
customer_reviews.text: It came super fast & it’s exactly what was listed & what I expected. I need it for a design class & it has a lot of information in it for whatever reason you’d need to learn web design for.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Best organized book on html
customer_reviews.text: Best laid out book on html I've ever seen. Using this to "get back into it" and it's got all the updated info I need to get back on track.
customer_reviews.author: S. Boothby

customer_reviews.title: Perfect book for a newbie frontend developer
customer_reviews.text: This is the best book for a newbie frontend developer. Although, the book teaches HTML and CSS perfectly than other section. I so much love the book.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Used for Class
customer_reviews.text: Comprehensive book covering all the basics of front-end design. The examples provided in the book were easy to follow and super helpful in understanding the concepts.
customer_reviews.author: Grace

customer_reviews.title: Pretty much the only book you need to learn html ...
customer_reviews.text: Pretty much the only book you need to learn html and css. This book is written by a person that was involved with inventing this stuff, Robbins knows her subject inside out and conveys it in simple, concise but thorough language. I only wish more "how to" books were written this well by a person that knows their subject so well. Would give it 6 stars if I could!
customer_reviews.author: Mark Bau

customer_reviews.title: Poor Examples and Exercises
customer_reviews.text: I have no experience in web design, but I was interested in learning. I was disappointed with this book, which claimed to be a beginners guide. The examples and exercises were poorly written and difficult to follow. I have made it to chapter 6 and am contemplating giving up out of frustration.
customer_reviews.author: I loveshopping

customer_reviews.title: Essential to your web design library
customer_reviews.text: I just received this book a week ago and it is one of the best introductions to html, css, and javascript I have ever seen. It introduces you to the content and gives you extra resources and then guides you through an example and takes your training wheels off. Other books leave you there wondering how the heck to do anything. I never leave reviews but this book is fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond
